alert.note: Alert for Childress; Hall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 7:39PM CST until January 02 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch with total amounts 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...Childress and Hall Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from Midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
